required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NEWBIE Validate: Feasibility of a New Test to Measure Glucose in Newborn Blood Spots (NBS)
clinical_study.official_title: NEWBIE Validate: Feasibility of a New Test to Measure Glucose in Newborn Blood Spots (NBS)

lead_sponsor.agency: Royal Devon and Exeter NHS Foundation Trust

collaborator.agency: National Institute for Health Research, United Kingdom

clinical_study.source: Royal Devon and Exeter NHS Foundation Trust

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this feasibility laboratory study is to evaluate whether the laboratory testing pathway for glucose screening in newborn blood spots (NBS) can be done at scale, and that the glucose test has a carefully established cut-off to define what level glucose is abnormal at day 5 of life.
The investigators aim to run this feasibility study for a period of 6 to 12 months to fully embed and test the process. This will equate to assessing glucose levels in approximately 10,000 NBS samples. The results from this study will inform a future large scale prospective screening study.

primary_outcome.measure: Normal range of capillary blood glucose in newborns at day 5 of life

study_pop.textblock: Babies having a routine NBS screening test within the areas served by the Portsmouth regional screening laboratory (NHS Trusts within Hampshire, Dorset & parts of Wiltshire)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Babies having a routine NBS screening test.
- Routine maternity care team within the area served by the Portsmouth regional screening laboratory (NHS Trusts within Hampshire, Dorset & parts of Wiltshire)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parent decides to opt-out of the blood glucose test feasibility study.

overall_official.affiliation: Royal Devon and Exeter NHS Foundation Trust
